answer.definition: Electricity refers to the phenomena associated with the presence and flow of electric charge.
answer.note: In conductors, electricity is due to the flow of electrons.

answer.definition: Electric charge is a fundamental property of matter that causes electrical effects.
answer.types: There are two types of charges: positive and negative.

answer.definition: Electric current is the rate of flow of electric charge through a conductor.
answer.direction: Conventionally taken from positive to negative terminal.

answer.answer: The SI unit of electric current is ampere.
answer.definition: One ampere is the current when one coulomb of charge flows per second.
Potential difference between two points is the work done per unit charge to move a charge from one point to another.
answer.importance: It provides the energy required to move charges.

answer.definition: An electric circuit is a closed conducting path through which electric current flows.
answer.condition: Current flows only when the circuit is closed.

answer.statement: Ohm’s law states that at constant temperature, the current through a conductor is directly proportional to the potential difference across it.
answer.graph: A straight line graph between V and I shows ohmic behaviour.

answer.definition: Resistance is the property of a conductor that opposes the flow of electric current.

answer.factors: Resistance depends on length, area of cross-section, nature of material and temperature.

answer.effect: Resistance of a metallic conductor increases with increase in temperature.
answer.reason: Due to increased collision of electrons with atoms.

answer.definition: Resistivity is the resistance of a conductor of unit length and unit area of cross-section.
answer.property: It depends only on the nature of material.

answer.definition: In series combination, resistors are connected end to end.
answer.equivalent_resistance: Equivalent resistance is the sum of all resistances.
answer.current: Same current flows through all resistors.

answer.definition: In parallel combination, resistors are connected across the same two points.
answer.equivalent_resistance: Equivalent resistance is less than the smallest resistance.

answer.advantages: Parallel combination provides same voltage to appliances and allows independent operation.

answer.disadvantages: In series combination, failure of one appliance breaks the entire circuit.
answer.reason: Same current flows through all components.

answer.definition: Electric power is the rate at which electrical energy is consumed.

answer.formulas: P = VI, P = I²R, P = V²/R

answer.definition: Electric energy is the total electrical work done.

answer.statement: Heat produced in a resistor is proportional to square of current, resistance and time.
answer.applications: Used in electric heaters, irons and toasters.

answer.definition: An electric fuse is a safety device that protects circuits from overloading.
answer.principle: It works on Joule’s heating effect of electric current.
answer.material: Made of low melting point alloy.

answer.definition: Overloading occurs when excessive current flows in a circuit.
answer.cause: Connecting too many appliances in a single circuit.

answer.definition: Short circuit occurs when live and neutral wires come in direct contact.
answer.effect: Sudden rise in current causing heating.
